msgSnippet: You can create a local copy of the API with (all on one line): javadoc -sourcepath /src.jar -d  junit.framework junit.extensions where:

From: Sameer Ajmani <ajmani@...>

You can create a local copy of the API with (all on one line):
javadoc -sourcepath <junit-dir>/src.jar -d <dest-dir>
        junit.framework junit.extensions

where:
<junit-dir> is where you installed JUnit (src.jar should be in there)
<dest-dir> is where you want the documentation installed
Note that you can list as many JUnit packages as you want, I've just
listed the two most common here.

--Sameer
subject: Re: [junit] API
